question: Will the USDA-posted recall by Yu Shang Food, Inc. of Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Products issued November 21, 2024 be closed before March 1, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the search results, I was unable to find specific updates on the status of the Yu Shang Food Inc. recall as of February 2025. Additionally, there were no direct announcements from the USDA FSIS regarding the closure of this particular recall. Information about the average duration of USDA FSIS recalls for Listeria was also not available in the search results.

Given the lack of specific information indicating that the recall has been closed, and considering that recalls involving Listeria can sometimes take longer due to the severity and potential health impacts, it is reasonable to estimate a lower probability for the recall being closed by March 1, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.3

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the USDA-posted recall by Yu Shang Food, Inc. of Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Products issued November 21, 2024 be closed before March 1, 2025?
Background: According to the USDA: "Yu Shang Food, Inc., a Spartanburg, SC, establishment, is recalling approximately 72,240 pounds of ready-to-eat (RTE) meat and poultry products within their shelf life that may be adulterated with Listeria monocytogenes, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS). This release is being reissued to expand the scope of the [November 9, 2024](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/recalls-alerts/yu-shang-food-inc--recalls-ready-eat-meat-and-poultry-products-due-possible-listeria), recall."
Resolution criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if the status of the recall posted by the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) of Yu Shang Food, Inc.'s Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Products is changed from Active to Closed when [this page](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/recalls-alerts/yu-shang-food-inc--recalls-ready-eat-meat-and-poultry-products-due-possible-0) is accessed by Metaculus after February 28, 2025. If the recall is still shown as Active when the link is accessed by Metaculus, this question resolves as **No**.
Fine print: 
present_date: 2025-02-26T19:03:09.334123


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

This release is being reissued to expand the scope of the November 9, 2024, recall.\"","resolution_criteria":"This question resolves as **Yes** if the status of the recall posted by the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) of Yu Shang Food, Inc.'s Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Products is changed from Active to Closed when this page is accessed by Metaculus after February 28, 2025. If the recall is still shown as Active when the link is accessed by Metaculus, this question resolves as **No**.","present_date":"2025-02-26T19:03:09.334123","date_cutoff_start":null,"date_cutoff_end":null,"scoring_weight":1.0,"resolution":"unknown","resolved_at":null,"max_queries":5}

messages.content:
Based on the search results, I was unable to find specific updates on the status of the Yu Shang Food Inc. recall as of February 2025. Additionally, there were no direct announcements from the USDA FSIS regarding the closure of this particular recall. Information about the average duration of USDA FSIS recalls for Listeria was also not available in the search results.

Given the lack of specific information indicating that the recall has been closed, and considering that recalls involving Listeria can sometimes take longer due to the severity and potential health impacts, it is reasonable to estimate a lower probability for the recall being closed by March 1, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.3
